steps.action: ASK PATIENT: Are you willing to try a trial of empiric therapies to help differentiate causes? Specifically: 1) a 4-week course of a macrolide antibiotic (e.g., azithromycin 250–500 mg three times weekly or 250 mg daily) to target chronic bacterial bronchitis/anti-inflammatory effects; 2) initiation of airway clearance techniques (daily chest physiotherapy or positive expiratory pressure device); 3) a 4–8 week trial of proton pump inhibitor therapy at standard dosing to assess laryngopharyngeal reflux contribution; and 4) a trial of neuromodulator therapy (e.g., gabapentin) if empiric trials fail. Would you accept starting with options 1–3 concurrently or prefer to sequence them?
steps.action_reason: These empiric interventions help differentiate between chronic bacterial colonization/bronchitis, silent reflux/post-nasal drip, and cough hypersensitivity when objective testing is unrevealing; response (or lack) to specific therapy informs diagnosis and further testing.
